results.title: Dunderklumpen
results.creator_credit: Lynn Manwaring, G G Communications and Paulette Rubinstein
results.brief_description: A magical trip into fantasyland, with Dunderklumpen and his mysterious friends who appear on a night filled with magic. Features a mixture of animation and real characters. Based on the original Swedish version, produced by Gunnar Karisson and directed by Per Ahlin. This American version is dubbed into English.

results.title: Dumbo: a lesson in being prepared
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Youngsters learn the pitfalls of trying things before they are prepared in this episode from Dumbo. Timothy Mouse pricks Dumbo with a pin to make him perform, despite the fact that Dumbo feels uncertain about his act. The result is a crashing failure that literally brings down the house. A charmingly anarchic affray, rendered with all the wide-eyed wonder of the Disney studio halcyon era.

results.title: Dumbo. Father Noah's ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.
results.brief_description: One of Disney’s most endearing animated films. Dumbo is the story of a baby circus animal born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all the other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse. After Dumbo is involved in several disastrous performances under the big top, Timothy decides to launch Dumbo as a new star - the world’s only flying elephant. Also included in this program are three Disney cartoons: “Father Noah’s ark”, “The Practical pig”, and “Three orphan kittens”.
results.title_for_label: Dumbo. Father Noah’s ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.

results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Clifford Parris, Frank Stevens and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.

results.title: Duke Ellington at the White House
results.brief_description: A special guest performance of this world famous jazz man at the White House is captured in this film. Duke Ellington plays before distinguished guests and displays his great talent in what was virtually a ‘command performance’.
results.description: A special guest performance of this world famous jazz man at the White House is captured in this film. Duke Ellington plays before distinguished guests and displays his great talent in what was virtually a ‘command performance’.

results.title: Duke Ellington and his orchestra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Good years of jazz”.
Features one of the most famous jazz musicians of our time, Duke Ellington leads his orchestra in some his most popular hits. These include: ‘Take the A train, satin Doll, Blow by blow, Things ain’t what they used to be, VIP boogie and Kinda Dukish.’ Ample time is given to solo performances by many of the fine soloists.

results.title: Dues and the union
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, ONF | NFB and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: The importance of the regular payment of union dues and how they keep a union going is told through the story of a young pipefitter. New to the trade and to his responsibilities as a union member, Frank Weston found there was much to learn about both. Fortunately for him, his boss on the job - a skilled tradesman and a founder of the union - had the patience to teach him. Through him Frank learns the significance of prompt dues payment and the services provided by them, and comes to enjoy the satisfaction of active and interested union membership.

results.title: Duel in the sun
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick, David O Selznick Productions and King Vidor
results.brief_description: Scott Chavez, hung for the murder of his wife and her lover, sends his daughter to live with land baron Senator McCanles. The senator’s sons are immediately drawn to Pearl and fall under her spell. Brother is pitted against brother in this classic western filled with love, betrayal and murder. Starring Gregory Peck and Jennifer Jones as the ill-fated lovers and an admirable cast including Joseph Cotten, Lionel Barrymore, Herbert Marshall, Lillian Gish, Walter Huston and Charles Bickford.

results.title: Duel-duo (K)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault, Pierre Moretti and Jean-Michel Labrosse
results.brief_description: An animation film about a clarinet and a trumpet that meet, clash, compete, compromise and harmonise. Sound film without words.
